page.title: 02Pamington Court Farm 1
page.content: This is a page about the history of Pamington Court Farm.Pamington is a hamlet in {Ashchurch Parish.}It is recorded in 969 A.D.and its name with the "ton" at the end suggests that the settlement developed from a single farm.It does not seem to have increased much in size since then. In medieval times the landscape was very different from today.There were then 4 large open fields, used as arable land or left fallow. These fields were divided between the villagers.Each villager had a number of strips to look after in each field.This landscape changed after enclosure in the early nineteenth century. Pamington Court Farmhouse was built in the Eighteenth Century.It was built on a site of the larger previous house of which the remains are still buried to the North of the farm.
